sites.name: Maison Bonaparte
sites.description: The birthplace of Napoleon Bonaparte, this historic house has been transformed into a national museum showcasing period furniture, family portraits, and personal artifacts from Napoleon's early life. The museum provides fascinating insights into the Bonaparte family's life in 18th century Corsica and Napoleon's formative years.
sites.seasonal_notes: Less crowded during weekday mornings. Audio guides available in multiple languages including English, French, and Italian.
sites.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online to avoid queues during peak summer months. Combined tickets with other Napoleon sites available.

sites.name: Palais Fesch - Musée des Beaux-Arts
sites.description: This exceptional museum houses one of France's most important collections of Italian Renaissance paintings, including works by Botticelli, Titian, Veronese, and Raphael. Founded by Napoleon's uncle Cardinal Fesch, the museum showcases over 700 paintings and provides insight into Corsican cultural heritage.
sites.seasonal_notes: Excellent air conditioning makes it perfect for hot summer afternoons. Special exhibitions rotate seasonally.
sites.booking_tips: Reduced rates available for students and groups. Free entry on first Sunday of each month during winter.

sites.name: Cathédrale Notre-Dame de l'Assomption
sites.description: This beautiful Baroque cathedral is where Napoleon Bonaparte was baptized in 1771. The church features stunning polychrome marble altars, impressive frescoes, and religious artifacts. The cathedral stands as an important pilgrimage site for Napoleon enthusiasts and offers insights into Corsican religious architecture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful atmosphere in early morning hours. Special masses and religious ceremonies throughout the year add to the spiritual experience.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Respectful attire required. Guided tours available through the tourist office.

sites.name: Chapelle Impériale
sites.description: Built between 1857-1859 in Neo-Renaissance style, this imperial chapel serves as the final resting place for several members of the Bonaparte family. The chapel showcases beautiful frescoes, marble work, and provides deep insights into the Bonaparte dynasty's connection to Corsica.
sites.seasonal_notes: Particularly moving during late afternoon when light filters through the stained glass windows.
sites.booking_tips: Combined tickets with other Napoleon sites recommended. Photography restrictions apply inside.

sites.name: Citadelle d'Ajaccio
sites.description: This historic fortress, built in 1492 by the Genoese, offers panoramic views over Ajaccio's harbor and the Mediterranean Sea. The citadel provides insight into Corsica's strategic military importance and features well-preserved ramparts and defensive structures.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spectacular sunset views year-round. Can be windy during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Free access to exterior areas. Wear comfortable shoes for walking on stone surfaces.

sites.name: Îles Sanguinaires
sites.description: This archipelago of four small islands off Ajaccio's coast is famous for its dramatic red granite cliffs that glow blood-red at sunset, giving the islands their name. The largest island features a lighthouse built in 1844 and offers hiking trails with spectacular Mediterranean views.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best visited during spring and summer for boat access. Winter visits possible but weather dependent.
sites.booking_tips: Book boat tours in advance during peak season. Bring water and sun protection for hiking.

sites.name: Marché d'Ajaccio
sites.description: This vibrant daily market in Place Campinchi offers the best of Corsican gastronomy including local cheeses, charcuterie, honey, wines, and fresh produce. The market provides an authentic taste of Corsican culture and is perfect for discovering local specialties like figatellu and brocciu cheese.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best selection early in the morning. Summer months offer more fruit and vegetables. Some stalls close during lunch hours.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Bring cash for smaller vendors. Try free samples of local products.

sites.name: Place de Gaulle
sites.description: The heart of Ajaccio, this central square features an impressive statue of Napoleon Bonaparte and serves as the main gathering place for locals and visitors. Surrounded by cafes, shops, and historic buildings, it's the perfect starting point for exploring the old town.
sites.seasonal_notes: Lively atmosphere during evening hours when locals gather for aperitifs. Summer evenings feature street performances.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for people-watching and enjoying Corsican café culture.

sites.name: Plage du Ricanto
sites.description: Ajaccio's main urban beach stretches for several kilometers along the Golfe d'Ajaccio. This sandy beach offers clear waters, beach clubs, water sports facilities, and stunning views of the surrounding mountains. It's easily accessible from the city center.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for swimming from May to October. Summer can be crowded, especially on weekends. Winter offers peaceful walks.
sites.booking_tips: Free access to beach. Parking can be challenging in summer - arrive early or use public transport.

sites.name: Sentier des Crêtes
sites.description: This scenic hiking trail offers breathtaking panoramic views over Ajaccio's bay and the surrounding Corsican landscape. The trail winds through Mediterranean maquis vegetation and provides excellent photo opportunities of the coastline and islands.
sites.seasonal_notes: Best hiked during cooler months (October-April). Summer hiking should start very early to avoid heat.
sites.booking_tips: Bring plenty of water, sun protection, and sturdy hiking shoes. Trail can be challenging in some sections.

sites.name: Musée A Bandera
sites.description: This museum showcases the military history of Corsica from ancient times to modern day, with particular focus on Corsican resistance movements and the island's strategic importance in Mediterranean conflicts. Features uniforms, weapons, and historical documents.
sites.seasonal_notes: Climate-controlled environment perfect for hot summer days. Special exhibitions on Corsican military heritage.
sites.booking_tips: Guided tours available in French and Corsican. Student discounts available.

sites.name: Port de Plaisance Charles Ornano
sites.description: Ajaccio's modern marina hosts luxury yachts, fishing boats, and pleasure craft. The harbor area features restaurants, bars, and shops. It's an excellent place to watch boats come and go while enjoying fresh seafood and observing local maritime culture.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most active during summer months when the yachting season is in full swing. Evening aperitif time offers the best atmosphere.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required for walking around. Restaurant reservations recommended during peak season.

sites.name: Parc à Cupulatta
sites.description: Europe's largest tortoise and turtle park, home to over 3,000 specimens from around the world. This conservation center educates visitors about these ancient reptiles while providing a family-friendly outdoor experience in beautiful natural surroundings.
sites.seasonal_notes: Most active animals during cooler hours. Some species hibernate during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Online tickets offer discounts. Allow extra time for children who love interactive experiences.

sites.name: Pointe de la Parata
sites.description: A dramatic rocky promontory offering spectacular views of the Îles Sanguinaires and the Mediterranean Sea. This scenic viewpoint features a historic Genoese tower and walking paths through wild maquis vegetation. It's considered one of Corsica's most photographed locations.
sites.seasonal_notes: Stunning sunset views year-round. Can be very windy, especially during winter months.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Bring layers as it can be windy. Best combined with a visit to the nearby Îles Sanguinaires.

sites.name: Église Saint-Roch
sites.description: This charming 19th-century church in the heart of Ajaccio's old town features beautiful stained glass windows and serves as an important local religious and cultural center. The church hosts regular concerts and cultural events throughout the year.
sites.seasonal_notes: Peaceful atmosphere for reflection. Check local calendar for special masses and cultural events.
sites.booking_tips: Free entry. Respectful attire required. Concert tickets available separately for special events.

sites.name: Promenade de la Jetée de la Citadelle
sites.description: This scenic waterfront promenade extends from the port to the citadel, offering beautiful views of the bay and surrounding mountains. Popular with locals for evening walks, jogging, and enjoying the Mediterranean atmosphere.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for evening strolls year-round. Summer offers the most activity with locals and tourists.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Great for photography, especially during golden hour.

sites.name: Place d'Austerlitz
sites.description: This historic square features a monument to Napoleon commemorating his victory at the Battle of Austerlitz. Surrounded by typical Corsican architecture, the square provides insight into how Napoleon's legacy is celebrated in his birthplace.
sites.seasonal_notes: Shaded by plane trees, making it pleasant even during summer heat. Local events occasionally held here.
sites.booking_tips: No booking required. Combine with visits to nearby Napoleon-related sites.

sites.name: Musée National de la Maison Bonaparte
sites.description: An extension of the Maison Bonaparte, this national museum provides deeper insights into the Bonaparte family's life in Corsica and Napoleon's relationship with his homeland. Features rare documents, family artifacts, and period furnishings.
sites.seasonal_notes: Climate-controlled environment ideal for preserving historical artifacts. Rotating exhibitions offer new perspectives.
sites.booking_tips: Combined tickets with Maison Bonaparte available. Audio guides highly recommended.

sites.name: Plage de Capo di Feno
sites.description: A pristine beach located about 15 minutes from Ajaccio center, known for its crystal-clear waters and excellent surfing conditions. This less crowded beach offers a more natural setting with dramatic coastal scenery and is popular with locals.
sites.seasonal_notes: Perfect for surfing during autumn and winter months. Summer offers calm waters for swimming.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Limited parking - arrive early during summer. Bring your own refreshments.

sites.name: Vallée de la Gravona
sites.description: A beautiful valley just outside Ajaccio offering hiking trails, traditional Corsican villages, and stunning mountain scenery. The valley provides an excellent escape from the city and showcases Corsica's diverse inland landscapes.
sites.seasonal_notes: Spring offers wildflowers and mild temperatures. Autumn provides beautiful colors. Summer can be quite hot for hiking.
sites.booking_tips: Free access. Bring plenty of water and snacks. Some trails require good fitness levels.
